thread.title: Gulf Coast Runners' Oktoberfest on Saturday
thread.title_full: Gulf Coast Runners' Oktoberfest on Saturday

title: Gulf Coast Runners' Oktoberfest on Saturday
text:
Previous Next 
NAPLES, Fla. - Gulf Coast Runners, a 40-year-old 501(c)(3) nonprofit running club based in Naples, will be hosting an authentic German Oktoberfest on Saturday from 4 to 9 p.m. at the Pavilion Shops on Vanderbilt Beach Road next to Naples Cyclery. 
There will live entertainment featuring two Oom Pah bands, polka dancing, sing-a-longs, German food — including bratwurst, pretzels, french fries and sauerkraut — and German beer. 
Admission is $10 per person — the event is only for adults 21 and over — and each attendee receives a 20-ounce commemorative mug. All proceeds go to the Gulf Coast Runners Youth Development Fund, which provides college scholarships for local high school seniors. 
For more information, go to gcrunner.org or email Mitch Norgart at mlnorgart@gmail.com. Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
